posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Ranger /  Bard can be a decent combination.  Here is the outline of such a build:
Spoiler Arelith Voice of the Wild (Ranger 15 / Bard 15) Elf, Any Non-Lawful Abilities: DEX: 16 (22) WIS: 14 CHA: 14 (16) Leveling Guide: 01: Ranger(1): Weapon Finesse, Favored Enemy I, {Dual Wield} 03: Ranger(3): Weapon Focus: Shortsword 05: Bard(2) 07: Bard(4) 09: Ranger(5): Knockdown, Favored Enemy II 11: Ranger(6) 13: Ranger(7) 15: Ranger(9): Improved Critical: Shortsword, {Improved Two-Weapon Fighting} 17: Bard(7) 19: Ranger(11) 21: Ranger(13): Great Dexterity I, (DEX=22) 23: Ranger(14) 25: Bard(10) 27: Bard(12): Epic Prowess 29: Bard(14) Hitpoints: 270 Saving Throws (Fortitude/Will/Reflex): 16/17/21 BAB: 23 AC (naked/mundane armor/shield only): 24/29 Alignment Changes: 0 Skills: 02: Listen(1), Save(11) 04: Perform(3), Spellcraft(5), Tumble(5), UMD(5) 06: Perform(3), Tumble(1) 08: Listen(2), Save(2) 10: Spellcraft(5), UMD(5) 12: Perform(3), Tumble(5) 14: Listen(1), Save(3) 16: Save(11) 18: Listen(1), Perform(3) 20: Save(7) 22: Spellcraft(5), Tumble(5), UMD(5) 24: Save(8) 26: Perform(3), Tumble(1) 28: Listen(2), Spellcraft(2) 30: Perform(2), Spellcraft(2)
You would benefit from a gift or blessing or whatever it is called nowadays that boosts your DEX.  You might opt to also boost STR for more damage and carrying capacity, or CON for 30 more health and +1 on Fortitude saves.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
Ranger is heavily modified on Arelith but can fit well with a bard dip. Druid is less bard friendly.

You likely want to hit level 21 on your Ranger for Bane of Enemies and +4 blade thirst with +4 vampiric Regen.

There are decent 27 Ranger / 3 bard builds and 21 Ranger / 6 Monk / 3 Bard (dual wielding quarterstaff under monk UBAB) netting 9 attacks per round each with Vampiric Regen :)

Let me know if you want to go that way and I’ll link in whatever you want to look at.
